alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Person (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 2:20PM EST until January 09 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...The Piedmont and western Sandhills of central North Carolina, including the following counties: Alamance, Anson, Chatham, Davidson, Durham, Forsyth, Franklin, Granville, Guilford, Lee, Montgomery, Moore, Orange, Person, Randolph, Richmond, Stanly, Vance, Wake and Warren. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - One and a half to three inches of rain, most of which will fall during a short period of time in heavy showers and isolated thunderstorms Tuesday afternoon and evening, will increase the risk of flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
